headline: Easy Slow Cooker Swedish Meatballs
description: This Swedish meatball crockpot recipe uses frozen meatballs simmered with mushroom soup, beef broth, and sour cream in a slow cooker for an easy meal.

video.description: These make-ahead slow cooker Swedish meatballs are perfect for family dinners. For a meal, serve over wide egg noodles, or serve them without noodles for an appetizer.
video.name: How to Make Easy Slow Cooker Swedish Meatballs

name: Easy Slow Cooker Swedish Meatballs
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 (28 ounce) package frozen cooked meatballs, thawed

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together beef broth and condensed soup in a slow cooker. Add steak sauce, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Stir in meatballs and onion.
Stir in sour cream. Continue cooking until sauce is heated through, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made these meatballs and this is now one of our favorite dishes. I used unfrozen Italian seasonsed meatballs. I didn't have cream of mushroom soup so used a dry packet pork gravy mix (only thing I had in my pantry) and added a little water when whisking with beef broth. We served over egg noodles. Only cooked on low for 3 hours. Was even better then second day.
I forgot the sour cream but still very good.
Very good. I followed the recipe except I sautÃ©ed some mushrooms and added them the last 30 minutes. My wife said we are adding this to the dinner rotation.

This recipe turned out so good. I love Swedish meatballs and this recipe was fantastic and easy to make. The only thing I had to do extra was use some cornstarch to thicken up the sauce because it was too thin but that's easy. My whole family enjoyed this dish.
I thought it was great. My roommate loved it too. Very simple and easy. I used a very high quality egg noodle. I recommend using them. They really absorbed the sauce great.

I followed the recipe and oh wow, the flavor!! The meatballs were so tender and tasty. The sauce was amazing also. I put it over buttered noodles. My husband loved it. I'll definitely be making these again in the future!! Try this recipe it's so easy and so worth it!
This was a delicious recipe. I do agree with others that no extra salt is needed. My entire family enjoyed this, we'll definitely have it again soon!

Made these last night as an appetizer. They came out really good. The only thing I changed was that I used golden mushroom soup so I was able to use less broth I also used a full cup of sour cream. I made extra so I would have some for over egg noodles tonight. 2 meals from 1 slow cooker easy recipe

The flavor was delicious, but the onions were crunchy, which the hubster doesn't like. Next time, I would either saute the onions prior to mixing them in, or omit them. Also, I doubled the recipe with 1 lb of ground pork and 1 lb of ground beef. The meatballs were a little dense, but very tasty. I might try using an egg with each pound of meat next time.

I have been cooking alot lately and my family says all of the stuff ive made is good but THIS is their favorite! Making it again today because my dad wanted some! Had to double the recipe last time it wasnt enough ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ i love it so much! Reminds me of those GOOD TV dinner Swedish meatballs they use to make ðŸ’•ðŸ’•
My absolute favorite recipe for the crockpot ! Iâ€™ve made it dozens of times ! Itâ€™s so satisfying and delicious !

I made it as is, except I added the corn starch, as it was very thin.
Will be making this again!!
Easy and delicious.
Made this with noodles and had left overs with rice the next day! So yummy!
Pretty good

Pretty good! Not sure it really needs to be on high for 4 hours since the meatballs were already cooked. I lowered it to low for the last hour. The sauce was kinda thin so I added 1/4 tsp of cornstarch in the last 30 minutes. I would hold off on adding the salt next time since thereâ€™s already salt in a lot of the other ingredients. Just salt to taste at the end.
It was flavorful and we liked it but the gravy was very thin. Next time I will try to thicken it by removing the meatballs and using cornstarch and water before adding the sour cream.

Just deliciousâ€¦ We used it by the book! We did use brown rice instead of noodlesâ€¦ better for diabetics! Roasted broccoli , coleslaw.. you could also bake a potato and fill it with meatballs and gravy??
Easy and delicious. Didnâ€™t need to change a thing and Iâ€™m constantly tweaking recipes. Had it over egg noodles, but would be just as good over rice.
Perfect as is, no changes made or needed! Husband loved it.
This was delicious. I tripled all the ingredients to have enough for 15 people. Everyone really enjoyed them.
Turned out really good - used pappardelle noodles & it was a hearty delicious dish â€¦
Made it today but I made the meatballs from using a Swedish meatball mix and it is so good

Not the best Swedish Meatballs I've made, but it was a good recipe and my kids actually ate it. My favorite part was how easy it was to make. I made egg noodles to go with it. We also had some potatoes and carrots from a roast I made earlier in the week.
Loved it! I will definitely make again. I served the sour cream separately in a bowl and we scooped our own. Easy and delicious.
I just ate it. Delicious! thanks for the recipe!
This was absolutely delicious ! In fact, everyone loved it. Husband, kids and myself. Thank you for such a great recipe!

So itâ€™s still in the progress of cooking and it smells delicious!! I know we are gonna love it!! Question? Do you add the noodles while itâ€™s cooking or cook them separate. It just seems that itâ€™s cooking for a very long time with just the ingredients it has in it and it really doesnâ€™t need that long of cooking. It seems like itâ€™s already done after only 2 and a half hours

Well that was a waste of time and money. 
Tried to eat it but could not

Meatballs. It was good, but NOT what my grandmother who immigrated from Sweden or my relatives there, make when we visit. Swedish meatballs are not the same as commercially prepared meatballs for sale. The seasonings in this recipe don't completely reflect what makes meatballs, well, Swedish. One of the seasonings is Grillkrydda, which isn't easily found here in the US. Allspice can be used as a substitute. Worschestire sauce and steak sauce aren't flavors that are found in authentic recipes, either. Bottom line. This is a good-tasting recipe, but please don't call them Swedish!
This was really good, and so quick and easy to prep. I love a good hands off meal like this, and will definitely be making this again.

Delicious! Simple crockpot recipe. My daughter ask for Swedish meatball sliders but tasted so good we decided to eat them over noodles the gravy is fantastic. Definitely will be making this recipe again.
Itâ€™s really good. However, Swedish meatballs? No. Itâ€™s a stroganoff sauce. I liked it, my husband who LOVES stroganoff didnâ€™t. It was weird with meatballs.
really good and easy
